item.description:
The "Stone Age" times were hard indeed. In their roles as hunters, collectors, farmers, and tool makers, our ancestors worked with their legs and backs straining against wooden plows in the stony earth. Of course, progress did not stop with the wooden plow. People always searched for better tools and more productive plants to make their work more effective.

In Stone Age, the players live in this time, just as our ancestors did. They collect wood, break stone and wash their gold from the river. They trade freely, expand their village and so achieve new levels of civilization. With a balance of luck and planning, the players compete for food in this pre-historic time.

Players use up to ten tribe members each in three phases. In the first phase, players place their men in regions of the board that they think will benefit them, including the hunt, the trading center, or the quarry. In the second phase, the starting player activates each of his staffed areas in whatever sequence he chooses, followed in turn by the other players. In the third phase, players must have enough food available to feed their populations, or they face losing resources or points.

Stone Age: 10th Anniversary is a new edition of the Stone Age base game that features a double-sided game board (winter and summer), decorative player pieces, a revised rulebook, two mini-expansions ("The Igloos" and "The Wild Animals"), and a "Winter Is Hard!" variant.

item.description:
Seanchaí (bearer of old lore in Gaelic) is a matching/capture card game based on the myths and lore of Ireland. There are seven regular suits (Warfare, Legends, Landscape, Treasure, Roles, Religion, Stoneworks) which are captured by matching cards of the same suit. There are two special suits: Shamrocks and Dark Cards. Shamrocks are free points and extend a turn. Dark cards are discards against another player.

Each turn consists of an action followed by a discard. The action can be either capturing a same suited card on the Tableau with a card in a player’s hand or flipping over a card. The flipped card is now the only card that can capture: either a card from the player’s hand or one from the Tableau. Captured cards are moved to a player’s point field. A discard ends the turn which is either a regular suited card on the tableau or a dark card against another player.

Complexity and strategy is created by determining when to play Shamrocks to extend a turn, when to capture cards that can be effected by Dark cards, saving wild cards or other counter cards to combat a dark card, and strategizing to capture the cards that are part of a scéal (story). 
 The goal of the game is to amass the highest points after four rounds. Points are counted on individual cards as well as in combinations of scéalta (stories) that are depicted by matching icons. Dark cards are negative points and have special effects that can target other cards. Any cards left in a player’s hand at the end of a round are counted against them.

—description from the publisher

Set in the world of Catacombs, in Catacombs Cubes players draft various "Tetris-like" wooden shapes from the quarry to race to build structures from blueprints. These completed buildings are added to the growing town of Stormtryne. The player who successfully builds the most structures wins. The game features a novel "cube-building mechanism".

—description from the designer

item.description:
Take tricks, organize, never bust.

TonTon is a trick-taking game with a forty-card deck, with five colors numbered 1-8. You use only three colors of cards for a three-player game, four colors for 4p, and five colors for 5p. The game lasts three rounds, and at the start of each round, you reveal a mission card. The game includes three basic missions and two advanced missions. These missions give you targets that you try to achieve during the round, such as having top cards (explained below) that sum to at most 12.

Gameplay follows standard trick-taking rules. In a trick, players must follow suit when possible, but they can play any card otherwise. Whoever played the last 4 in a round leads to the next trick; if no one played a 4, then whoever wins the trick leads. When you win a trick, you must take the cards in this trick, arrange them by color with the lowest card on top of each color stack, then place these cards on top of other cards that you've won. Thus, over the course of the game, you'll build up to five color stacks (depending on the number of players) as you take cards.

When the round ends, you compare the top cards on your stack to that round's mission. If the sum of these cards is higher (or lower, depending on the mission) than the depicted number, then you bust for the round and score only 1 point for each 6 you collected. For all those who didn't bust, players score points based on how their sum compares to others. For the advanced missions, as long as a player doesn't bust, they score points based on the sum of their top cards.

item.description:
Tragedy strikes as your spaceship descends through the planet's atmosphere and crashes on its surface...You have become stranded.

A decision must be made: build a self-sustaining colony or get the find a way to get a strange alien ship working again.

In Stranded, you score victory points by constructing colony buildings and by investigating the alien ship. But, in addition to competing for access to best building and newly discovered technologies, you must negotiate how you will work together with other players to complete the colony or escape via the alien ship.

Each turn players take a number of actions with their explorers cubes depending on the cards they play. These actions can include: Claiming a part of the colony, which requires a set number of explorers, or claiming an alien technology for which you use your explorer to 'outbid' other players. Colony buildings and ship technologies when claimed are added to your hand of cards, thus increasing your ability to take additional actions in future turns.

Colony building and actions that repair the alien ship can be done collaboratively--and players can negotiate the completion of a specific building or the repair of a part of the ship to their advantage.

The game ends when either the colony is completed or the ship is fully repaired. Since players are awarded extra points for correctly forecasting which outcome ends the game, ad hoc alliances are formed as players seek to steer the game to their chosen conclusion.

—description from the designer

End fast, but the grudge will last long!

Kongkang is a party card game based on a traditional card game from Southern Thailand called "Kang". Players try to get rid of high cards and match those previously played to steal Banana tokens. When someone declares "Kongkang", everyone reveals their hand, and the player who has the lowest hand wins the pot. After three rounds, the player with the most banana tokens wins!

At the beginning of the first round, deal 5 cards to each player. Everyone places 2 Banana tokens in the center of the table as a pot for the round. On your turn, you must perform one of the following actions:

 Draw a card and play any number of identical cards. If they are special cards, resolve the action for each card.
 Follow the card(s) played by the previous player. First, play any number of cards that match the followed card(s). Then, steal that many Banana tokens from that player. However, if that player also followed the previous player, instead steal from the player who first played the card(s).
 Declare Kongkang. Everyone reveals all cards in their hand and compute their total value (with special card being worth 10). The player with the lowest total wins the round and claims all Banana tokens from the pot, where a tie goes to the one closest to (and including) the declarer in turn order. In addition, if the declarer didn't win, they discard half the Banana tokens to the game box.




When a player draws the last card from the deck, the next player is forced to declare Kongkang. After the winner is determined, a new round begins with these changes.

 The winner of the round becomes the first player for the next round. 
 Players with the most Banana tokens place 4 tokens in the pot, and those with the fewest Banana tokens place 1 token. Everyone else places 2 tokens as usual.

item.description:
Enter the Garden of Glittering Memories. Guess the secret of the Oracle and complete your collection of animals and seasons.

Each round in Yozu, one player takes secretly two cards. Each card has one symbol from four and one color from four. Other players shall guess one of the cards to get it. They say in turn one combination of one color and one symbol. If only one element is correct, the player with the card shall say which one, then the next player makes a new proposition. If the proposition corresponds to one of the cards, the player gets it. The aim is to collect a series of cards in one color or of one symbol.

item.description:
Ä€mul, originally announced as Silk Road, is a card game of bustling bazaars for up to 8 aspiring merchants. Draft cards from the market to collect goods and valuables, hire guards, assemble caravans, and make contracts with traders.

Each round players simultaneously choose one of their hand cards and place it to the market. Then, everyone gets to pick one card from the market in turn order. Once everyone has picked a card, each player must play a card in their personal play area. But only certain cards can be played on the table and others must be kept in hand for end scoring...

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Legend tells of a tavern called BARPIG, where you can hear squeals and oinks of delight; The sounds of adventurous pigs challenging one another for victory or fall on the floor trying. However, not everyone is allowed in the illustrious BARPIG tavern, and some aren't too pleased about it! So when the good pigs are away, the bad pigs break in to play...

BARPIG: After Hours is the stand-alone sequel AND a deck-buildable expansion to the highly popular BARPIG - The Adventure Party Game.

Featuring 10 brand new characters and a swath of new items, BARPIG: After Hours features more strategic gameplay, adding a thematically darker side to the BARPIG universe. Expect alliances and treachery alongside your typical bouts of laughter and ridiculous fun our fans have come to expect from BARPIG.

Planned to launch on Kickstarter in 2019, BARPIG: After Hours will be available to play-test at Dutch Comic Con 2018 at the American Book Centre booth.


What is BARPIG - The Adventure Party Game?

Imagine if you could embody a hero character with the power to challenge or otherwise embarrass your friends. But be careful, for those same friends wield powerful item cards that threaten to change the game at any moment!

Now combine this with a leveling system to keep it competitive and a damage system to make it vindictive and this is BaRPiG - The unholy result of a one night stand between card-based role-playing games and a mostly ridiculous party. This seriously fun and highly portable game is perfect for anyone, anywhere and everywhere.

Oh, and there will be pigs...

What started as a bunch of silly puns written on a bar napkin has since become our out of control hobby.

A memory racing game.
Get your elephant across the meadow to the circus tent by remembering the tiles.

A memory game for two players (or two two-player teams). On their turn, a player will draw a card, look at it, and place it on the board so the opponent can see the the front side of the card. The player will then have to recite all the cards that they have drawn. This will become harder and harder, and once a player fails, the opponent will get a point. First player to five point wins.

name.value: ヴァルハラスカウト (Valhalla Scout)

item.description:
Do you know the name for a baby turkey? Or which US state was the first to declare Christmas a legal holiday? Can you hum the tune to "Frosty the Snowman"? Put your knowledge to the test with this bumper pack of quizzes and games! With one quiz dedicated to all things festive, another with questions on everything from food and drink to geography, and a game that sees you humming the tunes of well-known festive songs for you teammates to guess, this set is the ultimate in holiday fun!

Set contains:
100 holiday quiz questions
100 general knowledge questions
50 holiday "hum that tune" cards

—description from the back of the box

The chivalrous strategy game!

By turning over the tiles, each player builds or destroys Walls, creating rather ramparts that protect their pawns, or Paths that allow their movement and the capture of the adversary's pawn.

There are 3 possible types of actions :

 build a Wall
 destroy a Wall
 move a pawn




During his turn, a player can decide to do 1, 2, or 3 actions. The same type of action can be repeated.

The player who captures the opponent's Queen/King is the winner.

—description from the designer

The death of the great Don Brocco has left a power vacuum, so now all the Mafia families in the city are fighting for supremacy. Which family will control crime in the city in the future?

In Carta Nostra, you are one of those families, and your goal is to become the most influential dynasty in the city.

item.description:
It's a balmy summer evening, and you're sitting with your family on the terrace, playing a few games. A perfect evening — that comes to a sudden end as a flock of mosquitos is lured by the light of your lamp!

In Mosquitozzz, you have to fight off the attack of this swarm to lose as little of your blood as possible. To keep yourself from being stung, you cover yourself with many repellents, and if all else fails, you still have your hand ready to slay the attackers. How will you defend yourself against the mosquitos?

Mosquitozzz can be played either competitively or co-operatively.

- Game play

Each player has his own set of cards. At the beginning of the game each player draws 5 cards from his deck.
In the player's turn these cards can be used to avoid the attacks of the mosquitoes. Then they go on an individual discard pile. 
At the end of the turn the player chooses one new card from a set of stronger "experience cards". This new card also goes on the player's individual discard pile. 
When the player runs out of cards in his deck he grabs his discard pile, shuffles the cards and builds a new deck.

At the end of a turn the player sends all remaining mosquito cards from his hand into the swarm and gives the lamp card to another player.
The swarm follows the light and then attacks this player. Before the active player can defend himself against the swarm the other players have the opportunity to play one concealed card.
They can either play a mosquito card which will reinforce the swarm or a defense card to support the active player (e.g. in the co-operative play).

- "Slap your luck"

While defending against the mosquitoes the player can play a card named "Flache Hand". Normally you play at least one card of this kind in your turn.
If you do, you take a number of markers inside your hands, shuffle them and slap them on the table.
The markers show a living mosquito on one side and a dead mosquito on the other side - so this slap determines how many mosquitoes finally survive the player's defense.
It is allowed to play multiple cards "Flache Hand" in a row.

- Target of the game

Each player starts with 10 drops of blood (wooden).

Competitive play: 
The game ends when one player runs out of blood. The player who has the most blood drops left wins the game.

Co-operative play: 
The players win the game as a team if no player runs out of blood until the deck of "mosquito cards" is empty.

item.description:
A remote district in turmoil, a few hours south of Kabul, bordered to the east by the sheer mountains where the Americans almost captured Osama Bin Laden in 2001. Zurmat is a mostly Pashtun district that the government of Afghanistan has only the thinnest veneer of control over. Taliban forces move freely across the dusty roads at night, spreading terror with their night letters, threatening anyone who cooperates with Kabul.

Just now an American infantry company sets up a Forward Operating Base (FOB) just outside the district center. The Afghan Army is starting to patrol, drones are heard above, and the occasional jet swoops low, explosions following in its wake. Meanwhile, in the mountains of Pakistan, bearded men in secure caves are determined to stand up to this increased Coalition presence. By mules, motorcycles and camels, weapons and ammunition make their way into Zurmat. This will not be a quiet year…

Zurmat is a two-player (Coalition versus the Taliban) game played across month-long turns with players trying to achieve their commander’s objectives while always trying to gain control of the peoples' hearts and minds. Each month/turn begins with a random event, then the Coalition player takes their turn, followed by the Taliban player. Each turn you will take an action and play cards. The game ends when winter arrives. Since winter cards are part of the deck of random events, the exact ending of the game may not be known until perhaps even the last turn of the game.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Last Full Measure: The Battles of Cross Keys and Port Republic

item.description:
Fremont and McDowell are closing in to destroy Jackson's army at Port Republic.

Last Full Measure: Cross Keys and Port Republic is a free print-and-play game of the battles in the Shanandoah Valley just south of Massanutten Mountain, June 8th-9th, 1862, the sixth game in the LFM series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to it's size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in only eight pages of rules. Play aids include Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and table; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and 254 2-sided counters.

This map measures 30" x 34" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex.

-description from designer

The Final Flicktier is a 4X dexterity game for 1-4 players that plays in about an hour. It's family weight in complexity but offers lots of choices and many paths to victory.

Players flick their space ships (dice) around the table in order to colonize new worlds, harvest resources, and attack other players if they get too close.

There are five factions in the base game, each with slightly different play styles to give just the right amount of asymmetry.

If you want a space game that plays fast and scratches the 4X itch in half the time, The Final Flicktier is the game for you.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
The Monster Among Us is a social deduction/hidden role game played over three nights. You and your friends reside in a quiet village. But lately, things haven’t been so quiet. A series of killings, always at night, has plagued your village. And one thing is clear: these attacks are not the work of mere men. A monster is behind them; but what kind?

A team of 4 to 9 villagers, each with unique skills and occupations, must band together to search the village and its surroundings in pursuit of the hidden monster. But there’s a problem. It is becoming increasingly clear that some of the villagers are not what they seem. No one can be trusted - not even you - because the monster is among us.

—description from the designer

Super Secret Stealthy Spies is a fast-paced, easy-to learn strategy game of big moves. You have four spies who need to leave your home base and enter the field on a very important mission. Covertly move through parks, buildings, and subways and be the first to infiltrate the rival bases! Use the subway entrances to travel to other subway spaces. Use parks as cover to travel several spaces in one turn. Mix up the game board tiles for a different game each time. a little luck and a lot of stealth will help you to win this spy game. Includes 12 Game Tiles, 4 Home Bases, 1 Subway Die, 1 Rules Sheet, and 16 Spy Movers in four different colors.

From the publisher

Are you not brave enough to mention you-know-who, and do you also participate in the game of thrones? Do you make a "skill check" before you behead the dragon, and do you dream about vampires at new moon? Here is the quiz for everyone that knows the way to Mordor.

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Do you get clammy when other people can't separate "they" and "them", and do you know the antonym to the word "advantage"? Do you yell at the tv when you hear a proverb used incorrectly? Here is the quiz for us who is not "born behind a wagon".

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.

Move the adventurers along their paths and try to collect as many fish discs of the same kind as you can! The player who has the best total catch at the end of the game wins! Use a little bit of strategy and hope for the best to win at this adventure for the whole family!


 Comes with high quality wooden game pieces and a polar bear. 
 The polar bear creates more excitement. 
 Exciting game play, designed by an awarded game designer!


—description from the publisher

North Africa 1,800 BCE

The peoples in the kingdom of Kush intermingled while vying for power and influence and calling on the spirits of the dead for help.

Fast moving, tile-stacking game with many twists, which pulls you into the transcendental spiritual realm.

SET TO PLAY

Each player receives people tiles in their player color. Players take turns placing their tiles on any open square on the 8 x 8 board.

PLAY

Players take turns to move any tile or an entire stack of tiles to any adjacent square, on top of any other tile or stack. Tiles cannot be moved off of a stack or onto an open square.

With everyone being able to move anyone else’s tiles, or alternative play where you cannot move your own tiles, loose co-operation and negotiation are key.

END OF PLAY

The game is over when there are no more moves. The winner has the most tiles visible, either as single tiles or on top of a stack. The player with the highest stack wins a draw.

SPIRITUAL REALM EXPANSION

SET TO PLAY

Each player receives less tiles and players share the use of 8 spirit and 4 dangerous spirit tiles.

PLAY

This is best played with the alternative play. Players can move any of the spirit tiles. The apple and orchid spirits must always remain visible. When the ice is visible on a stack it can be moved once or twice each turn. When one player moves the apple, or a stack with the apple on top of it, onto one of their own visible tiles THAT PLAYER BECOMES THE SPIRITS and scores the spirit’s points instead of their own color.

END OF PLAY

The spirits are very powerful and score like a player and may beat everybody!

KUSH IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES.

—description from the publisher

"Did you receive my last letter? Good. I know that being placed in the high council takes a lot of responsibility. Steering the union into wealth and prosperity without bias or favoritism is not an easy task. That is why they picked you. That is why I picked you. Ensure that certain factions prosper more than the others, without being obvious, and I will make sure your political career is long and illustrious. If not, I can find someone else to assist me. ~Your Benefactor."

Your goal as a high council member is to have seven influence points by doing favors and spotting traitors. Most rounds, the active player moves a shared worker token to an empty trade deal space and players vote to raise both factions. Should be easy, but if your bias is discovered, you'll be exposed and censured. Better to play sub-optimally or spark a scandal or two. Be careful about moving up too quickly: you'll be watched more carefully and have extra administrative duties to distract you from your real work: doing the will of your benefactor.

—description from the publisher

link.value: 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest

item.description:
GREECE circa 800 BCE - 400 CE

Greece is covered in darkness. Do you remember the days of light? In your quest to save the city of Sparta, you hear rumors of a powerful oracle at the temple of Apollo in Delphi.

A skillful memory game for young and not so young, with Medusa’s and a dangerous dragon.

Can you remember where matching tiles are hidden on the 8 x 8 square board? Enhance your memory with the power of the oracles matches? Beware! Each time the dragon is found and not matched, it turns the board around, steals your matches and may even win the game.

There is also a TIME SLIDING ALTERNATIVE PLAY.

There are myths and rumors that Pythia mastered the mysterious art of time sliding. She drank the foaming waters that spurted from a chasm in the earth to start her slide through time and banish the darkness. Time sliding is when you experience the same events in a loop over and over again. When you die you slide back in time and start again. The loop can only be broken after success in some great challenge. Otherwise you are doomed to slide for eternity! The secret is to set yourself up for success in the next loop by what you do and remember in the loops before. Many do not believe time sliding exists and that it is possible to successfully escape the slide. Are you bold enough to find out yourself?

Play alone or with as many others as you like. The length of play is timed. Each turn you fail, you replace the tiles so it is easier to remember
the matches. The unmatched tiles and all the tiles you have just collected are placed back onto any open square, before turning them over. Then you start another turn.

There is also a WORLD WIDE EXPANSION.

Pythia was renowned all over the world. Nothing was completely hidden from her sight. Your spatial conception is challenged in this fun experience of your favorite places.

Choose a play area, which may be a room, park, or wherever you want to play. All of the tiles are placed face down, in plain sight, scattered within the defined area of play. Tiles may be on the ground or different objects such as plants may be used to make it interesting to search for the tiles.

Time sliding and the world wide expansion can be played together for a unique experience.

THOLOS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the designer

1950/1960: The race into space is in full swing! We're making great progress on the techniques for supplying astronauts and space-ready machines, for optimizing launch conditions, and of course for designing the much-needed rockets. All this to explore the sheer vastness of space.

But in Lift Off, not only are two superpowers competing for the most glorious milestones of space travel, no, we players are also very involved. In this game, we each play a private space agency that wants to develop in their own areas. We must hire specialists, improve our rockets, and expand our capabilities because soon we have to decide which missions we want to carry out and what we want to bring into space. Only those who plan ahead and properly manage the resources available will win this race to the stars...

•••

1950/1960: Das Rennen ins All ist im vollen Gange! Die Techniken zur Versorgung der Raumfahrer und Maschinen, optimierte Startbedingungen, sowie die Konstruktionen der Flugkörper machen große Fortschritte. Dies alles um die schier unendliche Weite des Alls zu erkunden.

Doch in Lift Off konkurrieren nicht nur 2 Supermächte um die glorreichsten Meilensteine der Raumfahrt, nein auch wir Spieler mischen kräftig mit. Hier spielen wir jeder eine private Raumfahrtagentur die sich in ganz eigenen Bereichen entwickeln will. Dazu heuern wir Spezialisten an, verbessern unsere Raketen und erweitern unsere Fähigkeiten. Denn bald müssen wir uns entscheiden welche Missionen wir durchführen wollen und was wir ins All bringen wollen… Nur wer hier voraus plant und richtig mit den verfügbaren Mitteln wirtschaftet, wird am Ende Sieger des Rennens zu den Sternen…

item.description:
GREECE 5,000 BCE

The Ancients were masters in telling of stories, dreams, visions and prophesies. Their stories were inspired by mysterious symbols, colors and numbers.

Draw symbol tiles from the bag and use them to create the story you want to tell. A tile can be used more than once, and both sides of the tiles can be used within the same story. Its easy to invent a few fables to amuse your friends.

Enchant your audience and win applause disks. May the best dream win.

Carry a bag of tiles and scoring disks with you where ever you go. You are always ready to play.

DREAMLANDS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the designer

AEGEAN SEA 4,000 BCE

Dark obsidian, a glass-like stone, was mined on the volcanic Greek island of Melos for thousands of years. Obsidian was extremely valuable and used to make razor sharp weapons and farm tools. The nearly lifeless island attracted explorers searching for the valuable rocks containing obsidian. They landed their boats next to the beaches and moved inland, where they mined the rock. They pushed the rocks to the beaches and then into their boats for transport overseas.

Choose your tiles carefully, so that together they overcome the resistance of the rocks and opponents. Push your opponent’s tiles into the sea to drown them. With more than two players, the scheming starts as you resist or not, or let some opponents pass.

Melos is only available as part of the Ancient World Multi Game System.

—description from the designer

MIDDLE EAST circa 700 BCE

Assyria is preparing for battle against the surrounding nations. A lone prophet, Isaiah, has visions of doom. “See, the Lord is going to lay waste to the earth and devastate it; he will scatter its inhabitants.” Will the nations believe that the Assyrians are coming to destroy their towns and cities? They say to the seers, tell us pleasant things and prophesy illusions.

Each round in this numbers game, threat tiles are selected but concealed. Players draw power tiles and may contribute them to the collective power. When a threat is revealed will their power be enough to overcome it? If so, you score the tiles that you kept.

Has everyone contributed enough to overcome the threat or kept their share of the resources? It’s tempting to make excuses and get away with it. Discover each other’s scheming and bluffing side or their open and co-operative nature.

An ice breaker for many players with fast moving discussions.

—description from the designer

UR FERTILE CRESENT circa 2,100 BCE

One block at a time, the Sumerians built wide, flat pyramids, called Ziggurats, in their city of Ur.

Be the first to move your block on top of two of any players’ blocks which are stacked on a foundation block. Stop your opponent’s blocks from moving by stacking on top of them. But watch out! Everyone loses when someone cannot move any of their blocks.

—description from the designer

BABYLON 538 BCE

Followers of the Most High God have been deported and brought to the Babylonian empire. During the reign of King Belshazzar they were threatened and oppressed. As the strife increased, there was no turning back. Farmers were put under the control of citizens, citizens were put under the protection of nobles, and governors ruled the nobles to unite them. On Tekel, the day of judgement, the Most High God will decide who has been found wanting?

Players must unite their people by stacking their people tiles in the right order by the time they reach their opponent’s back row. Choose carefully when to unite them, so not to slow their pace or expose them to oppression.

Tekel is only available as part of the Ancient World Multi Game System.

—description from the publisher

GREENLAND circa 1200 CE

The nomadic Inuit peoples of the Arctic were masters in using kayaks to catch fish. The frozen waters where icebergs drifted past rocky islands, were teeming with Greenland cod, halibut, haddock, and arctic char. They rowed out in search of their favorite fish and a balanced diet of all four sorts of fish.

Push a row of tiles on a 8 x 8 square board to stir the waters, ready to catch shoals of the same sort of fish. Catch the fish, by removing as many tiles in adjacent groups of the same color as you can.

Who do you dare to let know which is your family’s favorite fish? Could they help you?

—description from the designer

item.description:
Much land in Ancient Greece was mountainous and unsuitable for farming. Farmers competed to plant and harvest grapes, barley, figs, olives, currants and raisins.

Plant four seed tiles at a time on open adjacent squares and try to complete a line of seed tiles across the board to gain a harvest. When there are few open squares, you can remove some of your opponent’s tiles. It looks simple but as the board fills up it gets more tricky. Maybe you want to let someone get a harvest as they will do the same for you. Informal co-operation when more than two play can get you ahead.

Who will be the first to gain six harvests?

AGROS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the designer

Kickstarter exlusive expansion that focuses on protective magic and deck manipulation.

The Control deck was Kickstarted in conjunction with the Chaos expansion that features 158 new cards, with 30 of the cards being exclusive to the Control Deck, including the holographic Archangel Unicorn card.

A stand alone game.

item.description:
Kickstarter exclusive expansion that focuses on destructive magic and summoning from the discard pile.

All of the cards in the deck are Kickstarter exclusive, with 30 of them being exclusive to this expansion including the holographic Nightmare Unicorn card.

A stand alone game

King Grumpybeard's birthday is coming. Like every year, he should get his favorite honey cake because then he is happy — but where are the ingredients for the cake? Did the rogue Yardweasel leave them sitting on the steps?

In König Grummelbart, the animals have to jump from level to level to quickly collect all the ingredients. The king must not reach the big ballroom before the cake is ready. The players try to skillfully flick the animals on the steps and find the right ingredients. With a little skill and luck, they'll manage to finish the cake together...

item.description:
In Knapp Daneben! (Close to the Mark!), all players want to collect numbers close to what they already have, but not identical numbers.

Each player gets a scoring sheet and claims a different color from the five colored dice in the game. On a turn, one player rolls all five dice once. Each player must combine the number on their die with the number on any other die, then write this sum in a circle on their scoring sheet that's either their color or the color of the other die they're using. Each scoring sheet has 25 circles in it in a 5x5 grid, with each color appearing five times. When a player writes a sum in a circle that differs from an adjacent circle by exactly one, the player ticks the box between these circles.

After 25 turns, the game ends. For each row and column of boxes (with the 4x4 grid of boxes being located within the 5x5 grid of circles), the player scores 0, 1, 3, 6, or 10 points for ticking off 0-4 boxes. In addition, the player scores 2 points for 3, 4, 10 and 11 they wrote down and 4 points for each 2 and 12. Whoever scores the most points wins!

item.description:
Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood of Venice is a co-operative tactical board game of infiltration and assassination. Set in Renaissance Venice at a time when the Brotherhood of Assassins expands in Italy, the game gives 1 to 4 players control of never seen before assassins in a campaign to develop their headquarters and advance the Brotherhood's agenda against the Templars.

Players must find the right balance between stealth and combat to progress through a mission-based campaign, developing their own abilities as well as their new headquarters.

—description from the publisher

item.description: The popular quiz show with Kai Pflaume, Bernhard Hoëcker and Elton is now also available as a quiz game for the whole family! The players choose Team Elton or Team Bernhard, and the fun starts - with more than 700 questions on topics that nobody really knows the answer to! Or maybe yes? Maybe a teammate has a hunch or someone from the audience. Sometimes the well-tried exclusion process helps. In the master question then it is important to put the money earned clever, hopefully not everything just before the end to gamble.

There's something going on! Petzi and his friends Pelle, Pingu and Seebär are racing. Even pancakes fly through the air. With your catapults you throw the pancakes across the boat. You meet the given targets skillfully, you are allowed to advance your character. And since Petzi and his friends also need jam for a successful pancake party, jam jars have to be found in between. If you are lucky enough to reveal most of the glasses, you can also draw with your figure.

Trans Europa & Trans Amerika includes two simple railway games in the same box that use the same rules, but are played on different maps, which provide different playing experiences.

In each game, you start each round of play with a secret set of five cities strung across either Europe or the U.S. (depending on the side of the game board you're using) that need to be connected by rail. On your first turn, you place your starting station somewhere on the game board. On each subsequent turn, you place either one or two rails that connect two points on the board; you can place only one rail if you're crossing a river or a mountain ridge with that rail. All of the rails that you place must touch your starting station or connect with other rails in a network that touches your starting station. Thus, each player builds their own network initially, but as soon as those networks connect, you can place rails anywhere off that connected network

As soon as a player connects all five of their cities in a network, which could happen on another player's turn, the round ends. Whoever has connected all of their cities scores 4 points; each other player scores 0-3 points depending on how many rails they would need to place to connect all of their cities. You then clear the board, shuffle the cards, and play another round. The first player to score 13 or more points wins! The player who can make the best use of the other players' networks is generally victorious.

Trans Europa & Trans Amerika includes 19 special cards that can be used to provide more variety in gameplay. At the start of a round, reveal one of the cards; the effect of this card applies to all players during this round, perhaps with everyone discarding their rose card and needing to connect only four cities, or having a mountain pass count as only one rail played, or placing three rails on a turn, or revealing two of their cards so that everyone can see where others are going in particular parts of the map.

item.description: The Wall, based on the television show of the same name, is played with two teams, with each team trying to earn more money than the other by game's end. One player on the team drops balls into different channels of the wall, with the balls ending up in troughs that are worth varying amounts of money. This player's partner attempts to answer trivia questions, without seeing how much money the ball-dropper has earned. After eleven questions, the player behind the wall has to decide whether to accept the guaranteed amount or to take a chance that the sum won through questions is higher.

item.description:
Thanks to the Google Assistant, the quiz game kNOW! asks questions that would never have been possible before in a tabletop game. The answers to many of the 1,500+ questions change daily and vary depending on where you play: "When will the sun rise tomorrow?", "How far is it from here to Honululu?", or "What time is it in Sydney now?" Google's free digital voice assistant has the answers to these and many other questions. Players might also be challenged by tongue twisters and other odd phrases. For additional variety, new questions and theme specials will be added "in the box" for free.

Thanks to the digital timer, the game takes as long as players want, with a rules explanation via the Google Assistant. If you don't have online access, kNOW! is still playable without the voice assistant.

The game comes in two versions, one featuring only the game and one packaged with a Google Home Mini.

FastAlone is a collection of board games for one-man play where one play can be played in about five minutes. You can play various games with dice and whiteboard markers.
The rules of the game are five kinds. Every one rule have two patterns of boards. So you can enjoy ten games.
One playing time is short. So you can play with a little free time.
Also, it's not just to enjoy clearing the game. You can compete with other players by score. Please enjoy according to your lifestyle.

Geggamoja is, well, Ludo, a traditional race and capture game enjoyed around the world. Ludo is related to Parcheesi and Sorry. All of them are simplified descendants of the ancient Indian cross and circle game, Chisinau.

The goal is to get around the board with all your monsters before your opponents does. Try to tackle your opponents of the board but look out so you yourself don't get tackled. There are several cards in the game for each monster faction with abilities to use in the game.

—user summary

Koulutusleikkaus ("Education Cutback") is a game about cutbacks in Finnish education system by the current government - against their promises (Koulutuslupaus - education promise) prior to election. Main characters are Prime Minister Juha Sipilä and Minister of Education Sanni Grahn-Laasonen.

Players start with a certain number of students and teachers (wooden bits) which they assign to different schools (from primary to university). During the game, cutback after cutback (different event cards) force players to fire teachers or do some other unpleasant action which leads to student alienation. Players may struggle against the cutbacks (eg. reassign teachers), but eventually they can't save everybody. In the end, the player who lost the least is the winner - or the best loser.
—user summary

Koulutusleikkaus on peli koulutusleikkauksista ja niiden vaikutuksista.
Kukin pelaaja pelaa koulutuksen järjestäjää, joka yrittää saada oppilaitoksensa aina varhaiskasvatuksesta yliopistoon asti selviämään parhaalla mahdollisella tavalla hallituksen tekemistä leikkauksista. 
Tässä pelissä ei ole voittajia, ainoastaan pienempiä ja suurempia häviäjiä. 
Koeta tehdä parhaasi koulutuksen pelastamiseksi! 

 koulutusleikkaus on omistettu koulutukselle ja sen tuomalle taas-arvolle ja kehitykselle, sekä kaikille opettajille, muulle henkilökunnalle ja ennen kaikkea opiskelijoille, jotka ovat kärsineet koulutusleikkauksista. 




—description from the back of the box (Finnish)

The Mannerheim Line Campaign (MLC) is a low-intermediate complexity two-player historical wargame that’s also easily adaptable for solitaire play. It allows players to investigate the parameters of the final Soviet offensive into Finland in the late winter of 1940. For play purposes, that historic outcome is considered to have been a Soviet minor victory.

—description from the publisher

Welcome to the zany world of Joust for Fun! To begin, gather your pun-riddled Knights, Yetis, Self-Rescuing Princesses, Luchadores, that ‘dude riding a giraffe’ (and many more)! On your turn, empower yourself with Court Cards that provide special abilities and then joust for FAN-tastic rewards!

The combat system of Joust for Fun combines elements of deduction, bluffing, and choice of how much damage you wish to inflict. The in-depth battle system allows you to strike with deceptively simple 1-5 valued combat cards! Just choose your attack wisely, if you aim to do (4) damage, and the opponent blocks with a (4), you’ll do no damage and gain no Fans!

Joust for Fun is a complete strategy game that runs for about 20 minutes. In regular games, Joust for Fun lasts until a player collects 12 Fans (but you can also play the special royal decrees and scenario guided Jousts, wherein the victory condition changes and you may spend Fans for incredible bonuses)!

Meet new friends like Sir Cumference of the Round Table, Dread Pirate Roberta, Sir Lances too Much, Lady Dun Waiting and Joust for Fun!

—description from the publisher

name.value: The Game of “Yeah, But…” I Am

item.description:
Each player or team begins with three pawns of the same color on the Ya But (start) space. In turn, each player/team rolls two six-sided dice, leave start, and advance around the outer track in either direction. A player/team may roll a die and advance again when answering a question about religion correctly. There are two sets of question cards. One set for beginners; another set for advanced players. Each card contains six questions. The asker simply asks the next question on the card. The correct response is on the back of the card. There is no penalty for a wrong answer. However, if while taking one’s turn that player says, “Yeah, but” then the player’s pawn is sent back to the starting space.

Players must follow the instructions on any space on which one’s pawn rests. A player may not advance a second pawn until the first pawn has reached Home of Humility (finish). The third pawn may not be moved until the second pawn has reached the finish space. A pawn does not have to reach the finish space by exact count. Any unused movement points are given to the next pawn. The first player/team to get all three of one's pawns to the finish is the winner.

name.value: Summoner Wars: Alliances Master Set Big Box

item.description:
You've been planning for years and have finally done it, you have made your way into the city vault where the precious Elestar Crystal is kept. However now you must race and battle opponents, slip past security guards, dodge bullets, avoid lasers, find the crystal and escape to safety with your prize, for in this safe, nobody is safe.

This is a print and play game with a 5-piece double-sided modular board, originally created for the 2017 Nine Card Nano-game Print and Play contest. The rules for setting up the game are quite loose allowing for many variations and levels of play. You can even make up your own special rules for the boards you make (for example you must touch all five cards of the board before leaving the vault). You can overlap boards, you can use less than 5 boards, you can use the sample boards in the rules, you can decide how many security guards to play with (if there are less players you could even use the unused player meeples as security guards for extra challenge), you can decide if you want to use the holographic crystal, etc. the point of it is, get creative. Once you have a board set up, you and the other players must race to grab the crystal while dodging around walls, avoiding lasers and security guards, and dueling each other to grab the crystal out of the hands of the opponent. Then you must get back to the vault door and punch in the code to escape into the night with your prize.

In addition to printing the files for this game you will also need:
-4 different colored meeples
-3 black meeples
-2 acrylic crystals
-3 green d6s
-3 red d6s
-1 black d6

—description from the designer

link.value: 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest

name.value: Galactic Contract: A Strategic Resource Management Game

item.description:
"Captains! The Galactic Construction Company (GCC) welcomes you to compete for our coveted Galactic Contract! Each of you has been outfitted with a ship from our fleet and is now expected to fulfill shipments to the GCC. Upgrade your ship and trade with planets to gain advantages; complete shipments to allow us to construct improvements. Now get to your ships!" - Galactic Contract Rulebook

THE GAME

Galactic Contract is about resource management. Your goal is to collect as many points as possible by collecting resources and allocating them strategically around the solar system.

You and 2-3 friends play as contractors each trying to prove that you deserve the lucrative Galactic Contract from the GCC. Gain points by purchasing upgrades, trading with planets, and fulfilling shipments for the GCC.

—description from the publisher

Your Inteligence Agency has received news of leaks of information to a foreign country. Your team has been commissioned to attend one of the most committed embassies. You must send your Agents to gather information, your Infiltrators to protect them and your Recruiters to try capture rival agents.

In La Agencia: Misión Embajada, every player takes 8 cards. 1 Agent of each value (from 1 to 5), 2 Recruiters and 1 Infiltrator and shuffles these cards forming a deck.

Every round, the initial player, will decide if it is played in the Gardens or the Hall. The players will choose a card from among their four (one revealed for all players, one unrevealed for all players, one revelealed only for the owner and one revealed for all players except its owner) to get as many Information Points. The Agents will provide you Information Points, the Recruiters will exchange themselves for Agents and the Infiltrators will exchange themselves for Recruiters (avoiding that can affect any Agent). At the end of the game, whoever gets the most Information Points will be the winner.

Your actions will make you gain or lose information, and you will have to manage your cards and your intuition well for being the most succesful player.

—description from the publisher

Deepwater is a solo game set in the year 2047 - in which the player assumes the role of a tech billionaire taking over a loss-making, underwater, deep-sea research and farming facility, six months after an industrial accident at the base released a crystalline, genetically engineered mutagen named "Zenobia" into the sea.

During each game, the player will have to recruit marine biologists, deep-sea engineers, offshore operations staff, and security personnel. As the game progresses, the player will also have many opportunities to build onto their facility, and develop superior underwater tech and submersibles - to help achieve their character-specific goals. Will the player be a philanthropist, or a greedy business magnate, for example.

Many dangerous situations will arise throughout the game, which the player will have to make tough decisions to overcome - including underwater earthquakes, superstructure fails, flooding, intrusions by Eco-terrorists, and shark attacks. The multiple choice nature of these hazards will lead to the player having to sacrifice resources, cash, crew, and moral standing - with potentially devastating environmental impact.
Deepwater presents a tense, suspenseful, narrative-focused adventure with each and every game.

—description from the publisher

An n-in-a-row game using 'spicy dice' (6 sided dice that each have a different face colored red). Players take turns rolling 1 or more or their unused dice and placing them onto the board. When all 12 dice are down, the 10 scoring lines are evaluated (each containing 3 dice slots). If a scoring row has 2 or more dice that are identical (even if they are owned by different players), then it will award 1 point to the person who has 2 or more dice of their color in that row. Some other scoring patterns and displacement rules apply in special cases.

—user summary

Memory, balance and dexterity game from 2 up to 4 players. Build the Christmas Tree and don't fix the base, in order to make it swinging. Take the game box and place the cover below it. Shuffle and place the letter cards vertically between the box and the cover, gift picture hidden. Place the gift tiles inside the box and shuffle them.

The player takes a letter card, then they search for the corresponding gifts among those in the box, taking a gift tile: if right, the player places the gift tile on the Christmas Tree and then takes the corresponding letter card, representing a point; if wrong, the player puts the gift tile back in the box face down. The next player will try to guess the correct gift tile, and so on, until one finds the correct tile. The game continues with the next player clockwise: taking a new letter card trying to find the corresponding gift in the box. The game ends when the players match all gift tiles with corresponding letter cards. The winner is the one who collected the highest number of letter cards.

Which are the available places on the Christmas Tree? Each level of the tree is divided in 4 sectors: players should place gift tiles of the same colours on each sector of the levels. The colour is determined by the Christmas Ball picture on each sector. Furthermore, each sector of the lowest level can have max. 3 gift tiles, in the middle level max. 2 gift tiles and in the highest level just 1.
Attention: If a player, while placing a gift tile on the Christmas Tree, makes one or more tiles fall down, they loose the just gained letter card, which has to be given to another played (they can choose whom). Fallen gift tiles should be placed back in the box with remaining tiles: increasing the difficulty of the game.

Entanglement is inspired by the Entanglement browser game by Gopherwood Studios.

Entanglement:

Place tiles to create the longest path possible in the game of Entanglement!

Create an elaborate garden labyrinth by placing one tile at a time, connecting a meandering path of twists and turns. How far can your path go? You'll have to see for yourself!

You're creating a spacious garden surrounded by Sakura trees, but you have a limited number of tiles to play. Create a longer path and a larger garden by winding through Sakura trees: each pass acquires additional tiles for your expanding garden.

Should you risk your limited tiles to set up a valuable move, divert your opponents' paths away from the Sakura trees, or focus on an easy path through another Sakura tree? Weighing what to pursue when provides a mental challenge for those who hope to master it.

How is it different than the web game?

A few game rules deliberately changed to fit better for table play, but all the components are there if you really just want to experience a real-life version of the digital game. Here are the major changes:
The board game focuses on the limited-tile play of the Sakura-flavored Entanglement maps, not the boundary-based maps of classic Entanglement. This change makes initial setup much easier and prevents pre-placed tiles from shifting off-grid when they're not adjacent to other tiles.
Sakura tiles are dealt into players' hands instead of being pre-placed on the board. (This is for the same reason given in #1, and also adds a little more strategy and variety.)
Scoring is based on the total length of completed lines instead of on the length of individual moves. This change helps the game move a bit faster, since tallying scores like the web game isn't terribly fun to do manually.
The lines are thicker, and they don't glow. The thin lines were confusing to follow visually, and I didn't want the game to be radioactive.

Components: Box; 72 Hex Tiles; Rules Document; 6 (different colored) Pawns

The game is set on a gridded board seeded with face-down cheese and cat tiles. Each player begins in a designated corner and in order to win must a) cross to the opposite corner and b) collect two cheese tiles along the way. They are also in danger of turning up Tom tiles which force them to replace a cheese tile face down on the board, or failing that lose a turn.

—user summary

In Wer war's?, known as Whoowasit? in English, players must find the magical ring that was stolen from the wise king by the evil wizard. Playing against a running clock, players move their playing pieces through the various rooms on the game board to uncover clues to who stole the precious gem. Along the way, talking animals help players solve the mystery of the stolen item with the help of a treasure chest that randomly supplies clues on behalf of the animals. Whenever players meet animals, they must feed them so the animals — that can be understood only by children — can provide the clues that advance gameplay. The clues supplied by the electronic treasure chest ensure that no two games are alike. All players must work together to find the stolen ring, and they win or lose as a group, depending on whether they can master an assigned task.

Wer war's? Limitierte Jubiläumsausgabe is a tenth anniversary edition of the 2008 Kinderspiel des Jahres winner that contains the original game described above as well as Wer war's: Das Kartenspiel.

item.description:
In Kakerlacula, the third game to feature a crawling nano HEXBUG, a vampire cockroach flits through the corridors of a haunted castle. Working together, the children try to drive him out by turning on the lights in every room, but each time they encounter the cockroach, they lose a piece of their protective garlic in shock — and if their supply is used up, the monster wins!

Luckily, a fresh supply of garlic will be brought in via catapult if the children manage to shoot the vampire cockroach to the moon. Can they brighten the castle before their garlic runs out?

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Iocus Arcanus is a family fantasy board game, based on the amazing world of AitiA.

Every year, the magic apprentices must pass some tests that confirm their ability to continue with their arcane studies and become true mages. The great sages of Xrathgar, the Great Empire, thousands of years ago created three tests called The Trials of the Mages. The first trial is the Iocus Arcanus, a coliseum where the mages have no control over the magic and its luck that accompanies those destined to continue the path of the sages. The second trial, Draconis Arcanus, the search for the feather of the fenix dragon. And the last test, Arcanum Regem, the hardest and the one that really shows if the apprentices can lead the kingdom of Xrathgar.

The First Trial is held in this crazy coliseum, where the arcane energy transforms from one type to another. The apprentices will obtain different knowledge and the one who is able to learn them all, will win this trial. Of course, the other apprentices will not let you win, throwing away your soul from the coliseum, geting you out of the trial.

Simple rules, funny and full of magic, perfect for a family boardgame night!

—description from the designer

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
You are an averagely successful gangster in a small township. You are tired of doing small jobs that only earn stress and scars with no hope for a better future. After hearing about the success stories from gangsters in big cities, you decide to become the most prestigious gangster of all times, so you move to Crimopolis, squat an empty building and declare it to be your headquarters.

Crimopolis is a dice-free tile-placement strategy game in which players explore a city area by moving gangsters further and further away from their headquarters. Tiles feature streets and city blocks with parks, banks, graveyards, churches, lakes etc. Players assemble gangsters and execute jobs. The trickier the job the more prestige they earn. Taking over other players' assets also gains prestige as well as end game contributions such as villainy and hidden abilities. The player with the highest prestige wins the game.

Each player controls a variously sized gang of up to 7 gangsters. The game is played in turns during which a player can spend game hours at will. They can be used to recruit and move gangsters, explore the city, execute jobs, ambush others and/or take over their assets and invest into fortunes. Players are involved outside their turns, fulfill a time keeper role and counteract on the active player's turn.

Game depth and complexity (weight) can be adjusted to suit people with interest in light to heavy strategy games.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Explore the New World, settle unknown lands, establish trade routes, and deal in exotic resources to become the most prosperous colonial empire!

On their turns, players will be able to lay down their trade routes by placing a number of ships on the board. When a player's trade route reaches an island, they will explore that island resources and raise the demand of that resource on the Resource Market. Players can later settle the islands and trade the resources, thus gaining gold for the trade, but also lowering the demand of that resource, making it less valuable for the other players to trade.

Finally, the objective of the game is to have the most gold at the end of the game!

-description from publisher

A friendly game of balcony gardening.

Players manage balconies during the Villanova Balcony competition, obtaining different colors of flowers from a market and using them to create patterns. Each judge card will have a different requirement that needs to be satisfied in order to obtain prestige. Will the players be able to satisfy most judges?

—description from the designer

Match compound words three different ways: word to image, image to image equation, and image equation to word.

There is always one -- and only one -- match between any two cards.

Players sound out the letters while matching them with illustrations. There is always one -- and only one -- match between any two cards.

Pick a cooperative rule or race to find the match.

This addition matching game focuses on building Addition skills, teaching beginners the early fundamentals of math, while building and enhancing skills for more advanced students. There is always a match between any two cards. Find the pair between an equation and its sum, two equations or two sums.

Raise your multiplication powers to the next level, while practicing your time tables from 6 to 9. Combined with Multiplication 1, this game covers all the times tables for numbers 1-10.

There is always one -- and only one -- match between any two cards. Pick a cooperative rule or race to find the match.

This reading matching game focuses on the Dolch list of the most common sight words from children’s reading books, and helps prepare early readers for more complicated language skills to come. There is always a match between any two cards. Find the pair between a word and its image, two images or two words.

This reading matching game focuses on the Dolch list of the most common sight words from children’s reading books, and helps prepare early readers for more complicated language skills to come. There is always a match between any two cards. Find the pair between a word and its image, two images or two words.
